newsitem.title: HONG KONG: NatMutAsia to put US$12.5mln in China fund.
newsitem.headline: NatMutAsia to put US$12.5mln in China fund.

text.p: National Mutual Asia Ltd said it would commit US$12.5 million to the new China investment fund to be set up in conjuction with Axa SA and Axa's investment banking unit Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette Inc.
Axa, through Australia-based National Mutual Holdings Ltd, indirectly controls Hong Kong-based National Mutual Asia.
National Mutual Asia said a long-term insurance fund of one of its subsidiaries proposed make the initial commitment.
The fund, Axa National Mutual China Asia Number 1 Fund, is expected to have US$125 million in initial capital to be provided by the National Mutual group, Axa and Donaldson.
